meanings.definition: The reciprocal of the tangent function.
meanings.sent1: In trigonometry, we often use cotangents to find angles in right triangles.
meanings.sent2: The cotangents of acute angles are always positive.
meanings.sent3: Why did the triangle bring a gift to the party? Because it heard cotangents were invited!
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of trigonometry was as clear as the concept of cotangents in a right triangle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained cotangents using a simple analogy involving reciprocal functions.

meanings.definition: The ratio of the adjacent side to the opposite side in a right triangle.
meanings.sent1: When calculating angles, knowing the cotangents helps determine the sides of a triangle.
meanings.sent2: In a right triangle, the cotangents can be used to find missing side lengths.
meanings.sent3: The right triangle was jealous of the isosceles triangle because it had more cotangents to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of trigonometry was as clear as the concept of cotangents in a right triangle.
meanings.sent5: The cotangents of a right triangle create a helpful relationship between sides.
